steps.title: Easily Add Watermarks: Python Watermarking for {{FileformatCap}} with {{EnvName}}

content.title: **[{{ProdFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}})** is a Python library that makes it easy to add watermarks to many business file types. Follow these steps to quickly add watermarks to your documents in {{EnvName}}:
content.step_1: **Get Started with Watermarking:** Begin by creating an instance of the {{TextWatermarkerBold}} class. Pass your {{FileformatCap}} file (as a path or stream) to the constructor to open it for watermarking.
content.step_2: **Create Your Watermark:** Make a {{TextWatermarkBold}} object with your desired text and settings. You can add watermarks to any page or even to document elements like headers or attachments.
content.step_3: **Customize the Watermark:** Adjust the watermark’s size, position, font, color, and alignment to fit your needs. This helps your watermark look just right in your document.
content.step_4: **Apply and Save:** Use the {{TextWatermarkerBold}} method to add your watermark(s) to the document. Save the result, ideally to a new file for safety.
